title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.16 Part 2 | 07-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishala Kaya Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Svamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Ganadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Devim Saraswati Vyasm Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 16th verse of the 15th chapter of the first
canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This is the second part. The previous session we discussed the
first part. We will be discussing the second part of the purport in this session. The verse,
16th verse is as follows.
The meaning of this verse is great generals like Bhishma, Drona, Karna, Bhurishrava, Susharma,
Shalya, Jayadratha and Balika all directed their invincible weapons against me. This
is Arjuna speaking.
By Lord Krishna's grace, they could not even touch a hair on my head. Similarly, Prahlad
Maharaj, the supreme devotee of Lord Nisimadeva was unaffected by the weapons the demons
used against him.
So in the previous session we discussed about Karna. Elaborately Prabhupada described Karna's
history.
So in the previous session we discussed about Karna. Elaborately Prabhupada described Karna's history.
So in the previous session we discussed about Karna. Elaborately Prabhupada described Karna's history.
And now Srila Prabhupada describes in brief about the other powerful personalities. First
Bhurishrava is also called Naptah. So Srila Prabhupada says Bhurishrava was the son of
Somadatta, a member of the Kuru family. His other brother was Shalya. Both the brothers
and the father attended the Swayamvara ceremony of Draupadi.
All of them appreciated the wonderful strength of Arjuna due to his being the devotee friend
of the Lord and thus Bhurishrava advised the sons of Dhritarashtra not to pick any quarrel
or fight with the Pandavas. All of them also attended the Rajasuya Yagna of Maharaj Yudhishthira.
All of them also attended the Rajasuya Yagna of Maharaj Yudhishthira.
All of them also attended the Rajasuya Yagna of Maharaj Yudhishthira.
He possessed one Akshauhini regiment of army, cavalry, elephants and chariots and all of
these were employed in the battle of Kurukshetra on behalf of Duryodhana's party.
He was counted by Bhishma as one of the Yudhapathis. In the battle of Kurukshetra, he was especially
engaged in a fight with Satyaki.
He killed 19 sons of Satyaki.
Later on, Arjuna cut off his hands and he was ultimately killed by Satyaki.
After his death he merged into the existence of Vishwadeva .
Next, Srila Prabhupada grandpa resume worship to the Hanumanaya.
champions of the Shaтор reserved path of Satyaka equality for all booster through heart
section.
a brief history of Trigarta or Susharma, same person. So first of all Srila Prabhupada says
the Susharma was son of Maharaj Vruddhakshetra and he was the king of Trigarta desha. He was
also present in the Swayamvara ceremony of Draupadi. He was one of the allies of Duryodhana
and he advised. So this Susharma was ally of on the side of Duryodhana. He advised Duryodhana
to attack Matsya desha which is also called Darbhanga now. During the time of cow stealing
in Viratnagara.
He was able to arrest Maharaj Virata. But later Maharaj Virata was released by Bhima.
In the battle of Kurukshetra he also fought very valiantly but at the end he was killed
by Arjuna. This Trigarta Susharma fought very bravely but he was defeated by, he was killed
by Arjuna.
Next Srila Prabhupada describes Jayadratha.
Jayadratha was another son of Maharaj Vruddhakshetra. He was the king of Sindhu desha, modern day
Sindh in Pakistan. His wife's name was Dushala. He was also present in the Swayamvara ceremony
of Draupadi. See Draupadi's Swayamvara ceremony was very famous because Draupadi was very
very beautiful princess of her time.
Hmm.
Hmm.
Mind you Draupadi is described in the Mahabharata as dark complexion. So our conception, modern conception of beauty is totally different than what was the conception of beauty in the Vedic times.
In the Vedic times somebody may be dark complexion but they will be considered very beautiful if their bodily features are perfectly in proportion and the facial features are very very nice.
Jayadratha was always trying to get in touch with Draupadi after he was not able to win Draupadi's hand in Draupadi's Swayamvara.
So how much he tried is described here.
When he was going to marry in the Shalya Desha on the way to Kamyavana, he happened to see Draupadi again.
And it was too late.
He was too much attracted to her.

The Pandavas and Draupadi were then in exile and after losing their empire in gambling and Jayadratha thought that he would send news to Draupadi in an illicit manner through one Koti Shasya, one of his associates.
See lust when it attacks.
A person becomes a victim and unable to remain focused on his actual present situation and still carries that desire I want to enjoy Draupadi in an illicit way.
So when Jayadratha tried to...
Approach Draupadi in an illicit manner, Draupadi at once refused vehemently the proposal of Jayadratha.
But because Jayadratha was so much attracted by Draupadi's beauty, he tried again and again and again and again to approach Draupadi.
So finally he made a plan.
To forcibly take away Draupadi on his chariot.
And while he attempted that, at first Draupadi gave him a good dashing and he fell down like a cut root tree.
But at that time, when Dhamya Rishi, he saw this incident and he strongly protested the action of Jayadratha.
Those days, the Kshatriyas were expected to follow the code of conduct.
They cannot touch any other woman or kidnap women or take away women.
It's not within the Kshatriyas code of conduct.
So Jayadratha tried to somehow forcibly take Draupadi, but he was unsuccessful.
So when he tried again and again, .

When Jayadratha heard that Arjuna took a vow to kill Jayadratha, then Jayadratha wanted
to leave the war field.
But he was not allowed to do so.
Kshatriya once has come to the battlefield, he cannot turn his back, Uddecha api apalayanam
in the Bhagavad Gita it is said, Kshatriya quality.
He had to fight with Arjuna.
And
Krishna reminded Arjuna that Jayadratha had a special benediction of Lord Shiva that whoever
would cause Jayadratha's head to fall on the ground, such a person's head would actually
get chopped off.
So Arjuna through the head of Jayadratha died.
Jayadratha fell directly onto the lap of his father, who was engaged in penance at
the Shamantha Panchaka pilgrimage site.
So Jayadratha's father was surprised to see his head cut off, falling on his lap.
He at once threw it to the ground.
The father immediately died, Jayadratha's father died because his forehead was being
cracked in seven pieces.
According to the
benediction that Jayadratha had received from Shiva, Jayadratha's own father actually
had to die.
So that's the end of this purport.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
